primitive.navigateFromMBOMToEBOM.tooltip:
A Navigation Set that contains the MBOM occurrences. 
 
Example:
 SEL_PRCS
 PRCS

A Boolean array that specifies the three navigation modes: 
 iRef_Ref: If true, navigates on a reference-reference pattern 
 iRef_OccRef: If true, navigates on a reference-occurrence-reference pattern 
 iInst_Occ: If true, navigates on an instance-occurence pattern  
 iFilterOcc: true to retrieve only the product occurrence in EBOM root context implemented by the MBOM occurrence in MBOM root context. This parameter is optional. If this 4th parameter is not mentioned, behavior remains similar to cases where it is set to false. Default value of this parameter is false. 

 For example: [true, true, true, true]

 iRef_Ref: If true, navigates on a reference-reference pattern 
 iRef_OccRef: If true, navigates on a reference-occurrence-reference pattern 
 iInst_Occ: If true, navigates on an instance-occurence pattern 

 For example: [true, true, true]

A Boolean array that specifies the two navigation modes

 iOcc_Occ: If true, navigates on an occurrence-occurence pattern

A Navigation Set that contains the System occurrences. 
 
Example:
 SEL_PROD_SYS

A Boolean array that specifies the four navigation modes:
 iRef_Ref: If true, navigates on a reference-reference pattern for the scope
 iOcc_Occ_With: If true, navigates on an occurrence-occurence pattern for the "with" resources only
 iOcc_Occ_Where: If true, navigates on an occurrence-occurence pattern for the "where" resources only
 iOcc_Occ_Who: If true, navigates on an occurrence-port-occurence pattern for the "who" resources only. 
 
Example: [true, true, true, true]

 iOcc_Occ_Where: If true, navigates on an occurrence-occurence pattern for the "where" resources only
 iOcc_Occ_Who: If true, navigates on an occurrence-port-occurence pattern for the "who" resources only.

A Navigation Set that contains the System, Workplan, or Operation occurrences. 
 
Example:
 SEL_PROD_SYS
 PROD_SYS
 SEL_WK_PL
 WK_PL

A Boolean that defines to retrieve predecessors at upper levels or not. 
 
 If true, the predecessors at upper levels are retrieved. 
 If false, the predecessors at upper levels are not retrieved.
primitive.getCapableRscLinkInContextFrom: Navigate from System to Capable Resource in context

 iLink: If true, navigates the link to retrieve capable resource in context. 
 
Example: [true, true]

emptyComment.tooltip: A String to provide comments for current step
userAssistanceTooltipTitle: Click to open full documentation in a new window
userAssistanceTooltipBody:
When launching user-defined actions, you must select a procedure according to the needed type of completion, opening, or exploration.
 
 An opening procedure uses javascript. It consists of several steps. At each step, the provided javascript APIs (known as primitives) are used to, among other actions, expand, navigate, filter PPR objects to finally identify the data that must be opened in the authoring session.
 
 An exploring procedure is similar to a opening procedure, except that it explores the retrieved PPR objects instead of opening them at the end.
 
 Manufacturing Context Builder provides sample procedures that you can find on the Available Procedures page. You can, however, customize them to better fit your needs or create your own procedures.
